titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: My letter appeared in the 'Times' with so many misprints as to suggest that the usual revision of proofs had been omitted.

body.p: We lunched with Prof. Pringle–Pattison. His house stands on the edge of a beautiful loch, which comes to the visitor who has just moved slowly up the rather steep drive as a surprise. Here also was one Mr Cormick, the secretary of the Carnegie Trust.
